content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Discover a suitable chocolate cupcake recipe on Allrecipes that has a preparation time of under 1 hour and at least 100 user reviews.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find a suitable chocolate cupcake recipe, I need to perform a search. The most efficient way is to use the search bar. The textbox for search is [2], and the associated search button is [3]. I should type "chocolate cupcake" into the search input.
Action: Type [2]; chocolate cupcake
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The chocolate cupcake search results are displayed with three visible recipes. However, I need more information about their preparation time and the number of user reviews to determine if any meet the criteria (under 1 hour, at least 100 reviews). I should click on the first recipe, labeled [9], to view its details.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This "Chocolate Cupcakes" recipe has 1,255 reviews, which satisfies the requirement of at least 100 user reviews. I now need to check the preparation time to ensure it is under 1 hour. This information is likely further down the page.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current screenshot does not show the preparation time for the recipe. I need to scroll further down to locate this information, as it is likely below the visible advertisements and image gallery.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible section shows some recipe details, but the preparation time information is still not present. The "Jump to Recipe" button ([12]) may help navigate directly to the key recipe details including prep time.
Action: Click [12]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows the ingredients section, but the preparation time details are still not visible. This information is usually at the top of the recipe instructions, beneath or beside the ingredients, or above the instructions. I should scroll down further to try to locate the prep time section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view shows the start of the recipe directions, but there is still no visible information regarding preparation time. The prep time is typically displayed in a section either above the ingredients or directly preceding the directions. Continuing to scroll down may eventually reveal a summary section or a "recipe information" area that includes the total/prep time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current screenshot shows an image related to the recipe and an advertisement, but no preparation time or further recipe information. I should continue to scroll down to find the prep time details, which are likely further along with the recipe directions or in a recipe summary section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot continues to display images and video instructions, with no indication yet of the preparation time. To efficiently locate this information, I should keep scrolling down in hopes of finding the recipe summary or time details section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.82
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot mostly shows part of the recipe instructions and video, but still no summary or preparation time information. Continuing to scroll is necessary to reach the section that usually contains the total/prep time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.83
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current screenshot is showing step 5 of the recipe instructions along with more images, but still no information about prep time or total time. To find the required prep time information, it's necessary to continue scrolling down the page, as it may be found at the end or in a summary section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows step 6 of the recipe instructions, but there is still no information about preparation or total time. I should continue scrolling to reach the end or a recipe summary section where total/prep time is often provided.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows the end of the instructions section and includes statistics about user engagement ("3,311 home cooks made it!"), but still does not display the total or prep time for the recipe. To ensure no details are missed, I should continue scrolling, as the prep/total time may be listed in a summary or info section at the very end.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.93
Completion: 0.89
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows nutrition facts headers and the "Ask the Community" section, but no prep or total time information is visible. This critical information may still be located further or could be above the ingredients/directions. Given that we've reached community and nutrition info, we may have passed the summary. Scrolling up slightly could help, but since the prep time is essential and often featured in key info boxes above the recipe, an upward scroll is now warranted.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.89
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: After scrolling back up, I see the same section as before—image, buttons for saving/printing, and a count of home cooks. The preparation or total time is still not visible. Since scrolling down and up near the end of the recipe did not reveal it, I should scroll further up toward the main recipe area, likely above ingredients and directions.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This screenshot shows the end of the directions (Step 6) and cupcake images, but still no prep/total time. Since this places us near the step-by-step section, the summary and time information are likely still above, possibly near the top of the recipe. Continued upward scrolling is needed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This screenshot is at Step 5 of the directions. The prep/total time is still not visible, suggesting that more upward scrolling is necessary to reach the summary section at the top of the recipe where this information is typically located.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.9

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <button> "Save", "Save Recipe";	[3]: <button> "Rate", "Rate It";	[4]: "Log In";	[6]: "Join for free: Use MyRecipes to save 100K+ recipes from Allrecipes and more";	[7]: <button> "Close";

content:
Thought: The screenshot continues to show instructions and images, but no summary, prep, or total time information. The top of the recipe where the summary box may be located is still not visible. More upward scrolling is needed to reach that section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.9

Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.91

Thought: The screenshot shows images of the baking process (sifting cocoa and pouring milk), indicating we're still in the visual or instruction portion of the recipe. No summary, prep, or total time information is yet visible. Scrolling up further is required to reach the top where this information is typically provided.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.92
